etymology.description: Ideogram (指事) — an arrowhead indicating “to enter”; compare 人.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicts a pointed wedge or arrowhead moving inward, conveying the action of going in. Its form resembles 人 but with a tighter, inward-tapering shape that emphasizes entry rather than a person.

examples.chinese: 他考入北京大学(他考入北京大學)。
examples.english: He was admitted to Peking University.
